author: Colleen Dilthey Thomas
title: Venus Williams Confirms Engagement To Andrea Preti
text:
Seven-time singles Grand Slam winner Venus Williams is single no more. Though long-rumored to be engaged to Andrea Preti, Venus subtly confirmed the news in an interview with WTA, Today reported. Following her first match in more than a year at the Mubadala Citi DC Open, Venus let the news slip. While she didn’t mention Andrea by name, it was pretty clear who she was talking about.
Videos by InspireMore
“My fiancé is here and he really encouraged me to keep playing,” she said.
Venus Williams Wanted To Impress Andrea Preti
Venus Williams told WTA having Andrea Preti in the stands helped motivate her to win.
“There were so many times where I just wanted to coast and kind of chill,” she said. “Do you know how hard it is to play tennis? You guys don’t know how much work goes into this, like it’s 9 to 5 except you’re running the whole time, lifting weights, and just like dying, and then you repeat it the next day. So he encouraged me to get through this, and it’s wonderful to be here. He’s never seen me play.”
Early in July, Venus opened up to Today about her health struggles and stepping back from tennis.
“Fibroids impacted my career,” she explained. “I never had enough energy most times to play a real match the way I wanted to, and, of course, it affected my results.”
Thankfully, she found a new team of doctors who helped her heal. Venus Williams opened up about her health, hoping to reach other women with similar struggles.
“Hopefully someone will see this interview and say, ‘I can get help. I don’t have to live this way,’” Venus said. “I’m very passionate about this at this point in time because I know that other people can live better than what I lived.”
This story’s featured image is by Scott Taetsch/Getty Images.

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: Several regions of Huelva, on red notice due to torrential rains
text:
The Andévalo, Condado and Litoral regions of the province of Huelva have been on red notice due to the rain accumulated during the night and waiting that, in principle from 9:00 a.m., they may be torrential and turn orange; During the early hours of the morning, 112 handled around 80 incidents.
The president of the Junta de Andalucía, Juan Manuel Moreno Bonilla, has highlighted this through his social networks, with a message in which he has also asked “exercise caution . Please, let’s not leave home whenever possible and avoid travel or any unnecessary risk. Prudence”.
For its part, the Huelva City Council has also made a call for caution and protection while the mayor of Punta Umbría, José Carlos Hernández Cansino, has also warned of the situation and has reported the closure of the road that gives access to the town, while requesting not to remain in areas that have on occasion been closed. awash”.
Like Punta Umbría, Lepe, Cartaya, Ayamonte and Isla Cristina They keep their Municipal Emergency Plans active. The mayor, Adolfo Verano Domínguez, and the councilors of Citizen Security and General Services have been together with Civil Protection and the Local Police monitoring the progress of the storm during the early hours of the morning.
For his part, Cartaya’s Manuel Barroso has reported on the road closure that connect the center of El Rompido with Cartaya and Nuevo Portil and has asked for responsibility, after a night in which municipal services had to transport numerous children who were on the street to their homes after being surprised by the rains; Likewise, flooding has been recorded in the La Galera area.
From 112 they have informed EFE that since 2:00 a.m. they have managed, mainly in municipalities on the coast and the metropolitan area, nearly 80 incidents due to flooding and flooding of basements and garages; They highlight the entry of water into the basement of a hotel in Gibraleón and in a nursing home in Aljaraque; No human damage has been reported.
To these incidents we must add the multiple ones that municipal services have had to attend to throughout a rainy morning in which, for hours, strong lightning and thunder have been recorded.
#regions #Huelva #red #notice #due #torrential #rains

author: Jarvis the NPC
title: Why Team Fight Tactics (TFT) Players Think Rageblade is Just Plain Boring
text:
Team Fight Tactics (TFT) players are buzzing with opinions regarding the overwhelming dominance of Rageblade in the current meta. One particularly enthusiastic poster, under the name Desperate_Zebra_4085, launched a conversation that quickly snowballed into a hotbed of reactions. The game’s strategic depth and complex mechanics are ever-present, but many players are echoing a sentiment of dissatisfaction—decrying Rageblade as overly simplistic and claiming it has become a crutch item that stifles variety. As games are increasingly dictated by this item, players are clamoring for a breath of fresh air. Let’s dive into the chaotic opinions emerging from this discussion.
Summary
- Many players believe Rageblade is too essential and reflects a lack of diversity in build options.
- Concerns arise that if Rageblade were removed, the game would struggle to provide adequate alternatives for carry items.
- Some users express hope that future updates will shake up the current item meta.
- While a majority finds Rageblade boring, there are a few voices suggesting certain compositions can work without it.
The Rageblade Dominance
It’s no secret that Rageblade has become the Swiss Army knife of items in TFT, almost a necessity for any serious competitor. Desperate_Zebra_4085 noted their experience in a single match: “I count 11 rageblades in this game lol,” emphasizing how ubiquitous the item has become. This is not just a castaway remark; it highlights a systemic issue where the strategic variety that is the lifeblood of TFT is being sucked dry. Players like BamsN1337 echo this sentiment by pointing out that success often hinges on whether you are able to secure Rageblade or not, which can feel like a double-edged sword. Instead of focusing on clever positioning or unique strategies, players may find themselves devoting their efforts to just securing the right item. Long-term players worry this trend is getting stale, and who doesn’t love a little chaos in their matches?
The Call for Diversity
The game thrives on its variety, but when players find themselves lulled into a snooze-fest of itemization, it’s time to raise the red flag. Commenters like SauceKingHS have expressed their views candidly: “Absolutely. Boring, repetitive, and disproportionately powerful at all stages of the game.” When a single item can dictate a player’s success from start to finish, it raises eyebrows and should spark a discussion. The core argument KrustyBuns943 presented provides an interesting point—without Rageblade, what would even replace it? This necessitates new item balance and design, ensuring that the picks in a game feel distinctive and exciting, rather than requiring players to fight over the same few options repeatedly. Some community voices lament the lack of viable alternatives, fearing the meta has become a one-trick pony where risk-taking only leads to defeat.
Future of TFT’s Itemization
As players look towards the future of TFT, they hope for patches that will disrupt the redundancy of Rageblade-centric builds. User disposableaccount848 hit the nail on the head, stating that the item being a “mandatory item for backline auto-attack carries” has been a determining factor in the game for far too long. It’s not merely the nostalgia of variety people crave; they want a game where every match feels different. The community seems to be clamoring for an overhaul, or at least some serious tweaks that can allow for a revitalized strategy discussion around non-Rageblade options. Some users came to the table with fresh perspectives; roogie15 pointed out that comps like Streetdemons and Vexotech actually don’t rely on Rageblade, suggesting that innovation can still happen and may open players’ eyes to other strategies. It’s a gentle reminder that while Rageblade might seem ubiquitous, it’s not the be-all and end-all.
Community Sentiment and Emotional Investment
Community feedback is often a mixed bag, rich with emotions ranging from indignation to genuine exasperation. Hannelore300 articulated a thought-provoking opinion, comparing the current state of Rageblade to previous iterations of other items in TFT. “You could say the same about Shojin,” they stated, urging a broader evaluation of the itemization landscape. But let’s face it; most of the chatter is largely dominated by the players who are ready to see Rageblade either heavily nerfed or completely redesigned. There’s an undeniable attachment to the strategic diversity that the game was once known for. Players feel a sense of ownership over the game; after all, they dedicate countless hours to mastering their crafts. If the meta grows stale, the emotional investment dwindles, leading to a gaming experience that feels far less rewarding. When these nuances are brushed aside, the community feels overlooked, as if their concerns are brushed off in favor of the status quo.
As the discussion around Rageblade continues to unfold, it is clear that a significant portion of the TFT community is searching for greater variety and excitement. With vocal criticism growing louder, developers may have their work cut out for them in shaking up the item ecosystem. A well-balanced game isn’t just about finding the cheapest path to victory; it’s also about allowing players to craft their unique moments of glory. The quest for balance and variety is ongoing, but one thing is clear: players are ready for more than just “Rageblade or bust.”

author: https://www.zazoom.it/blog/chisiamo.asp
title: Lo sciopero di Cgil e Uil | Siamo mezzo milione nelle piazze Landini attacca | rivoltiamo l’Italia
text: A fine giornata, lo sciopero generale di Cgil, Uil e sindacati autonomi ha due cifre: una composta dai numeri dati dagli stessi sindacati (500mila in piazza e adesioni al 70 per cento) e duramente contestati dal governo e da altre single a colpi di altre percentuali (5 per cento nella scuola e negli altri comparti del pubblico impiego, e ancora di meno nel privato, con un 4 per cento alle Poste). Una seconda costituita dalle parole di fuoco di Maurizio Landini ("Noi vogliamo rivoltare il Paese come un guanto, c’è una svolta autoritaria"), finite nel mirino dei leader della maggioranza, tanto più dopo gli scontri di Torino tra polizia e centri sociali. "Mi sembra un linguaggio da fondamentalista – avvisa il vicepremier Antonio Tajani –. Lo sciopero ha delle motivazioni politiche, diversi sindacati non hanno aderito".Leggi su Quotidiano.net Quotidiano.net - Lo sciopero di Cgil e Uil: "Siamo mezzo milione nelle piazze". author: Daniel Kool, Portland Press Herald, Maine
title: Suzie the bear, longtime Maine Wildlife Park resident, dies at 30
text:
Portland Press Herald, Maine Suzie the bear, longtime Maine Wildlife Park resident, dies at 30 Daniel Kool, Portland Press Herald, Maine Thu, December 19, 2024 at 11:46 PM UTC 1 min read
Dec. 19—After nearly 30 years living in the Maine Wildlife Park, Suzie the black bear has died, the park announced Thursday.
The park did not say when exactly Suzie died, but said in a written announcement that her declining health and mobility indicated that "it was time to say goodbye."
"Suzie wasn't big for a black bear, but her bear boss attitude reminded her larger bear friends to respect their elders," the park said. "Her more delicate side came out during snack time. She was known to pluck grapes from a bunch one at a time with her dexterous lips and had a funny habit of balancing snacks on the back of her paws to nibble at daintily."
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Black bears can live for up to 30 years in the wild, but they typically die before reaching their 20s, according to the National Wildlife Federation.
Suzie celebrated her 30th birthday in August, complete with presents and a towering cake of fresh fruit.
The park is located in Gray and overseen by the Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife. Formerly known as the Game Park, the site adopted the name "Maine Wildlife Park" in 1998 — three years after Suzie's arrival.
The park announced Suzie's death on Facebook shortly after noon and within hours, the post had garnered an outpouring of support, with commenters sharing condolences and memories of the beastly beauty.
"When I would go I would wave at her and she would come over and stand up like she was saying hi," one commenter said.
Copy the Story Link

Advertisement
Big Red Barn gets unanimous approval to host bigger events
The Monterey County Planning Commission unanimously approved a permit that would allow the popular Big Red Barn to host bigger events. Currently, the venue is used to host the flea market every Sunday. With the new permit, the venue hopes to attract events such as weddings, quinceañeras, electric carts, weddings, outdoor movies, paintball and more. The plan is to also increase parking for the area and increase the number of vendor spaces available. There is no estimate for when these events could start taking place.
AROMAS, Calif. —
The Monterey County Planning Commission unanimously approved a permit that would allow the popular Big Red Barn to host bigger events.
Currently, the venue is used to host the flea market every Sunday.
Advertisement
With the new permit, the venue hopes to attract events such as weddings, quinceañeras, electric carts, weddings, outdoor movies, paintball and more.
The plan is to also increase parking for the area and increase the number of vendor spaces available.
There is no estimate for when these events could start taking place.

author: redaccion@elterritorio.com.ar (El Territorio)
title: Solidaridad en Navidad: inolvidable agasajo a niños del merendero Caritas Felices
text:
Solidaridad en Navidad: inolvidable agasajo a niños del merendero Caritas Felices
El espíritu navideño se vivió a pleno en Oberá, donde Daniel Benítez y Paola Antúnez organizaron, junto a un grupo de colaboradores, un emotivo festejo para los niños del merendero Caritas Felices. La jornada estuvo marcada por la alegría, las risas y los regalos que lograron llevar a los 45 niños que asisten al espacio, gracias a la solidaridad de quienes aportaron las donaciones, que fueron entregadas.
Dani y Paola, quienes comenzaron esta labor solidaria atendiendo a tan solo tres niños, hoy ven con orgullo cómo su iniciativa creció, debiendo entonces redoblar los esfuerzos. "Agradecemos profundamente a todas las personas que nos ayudaron donando golosinas para este festejo", expresó la pareja, exponiendo el verdadero significado de la Navidad: compartir, dar y unir corazones en favor de quienes más lo necesitan.
La celebración incluyó momentos de juegos, y, sobre todo, sonrisas de los pequeños, quienes recibieron con entusiasmo cada regalo y gesto de cariño. Pero la labor de Dani y Paola se extiende más allá de este agasajo navideño, ya que continúan recolectando juguetes y ropa para seguir ayudando a las familias que forman parte del merendero.
"Sabemos que muchos tienen cosas en sus casas que ya no usan, y para nosotros pueden ser la alegría de un niño. Invitamos a todos a sumarse", comentaron. Aquellos interesados en colaborar con esta noble causa pueden comunicarse con la pareja a los teléfonos 3764694160 o 3755527638.

author: Jonee' Lewis p94157 (Police Department)
title: Tampa Police Department Launches A "HEART AND SOLE" Shoe Drive
text: TAMPA, Fla.- March 15 is known as “National Shoe the World Day”, a day that sheds light on the importance of footwear and the need for quality footwear for millions of people worldwide who can’t afford or don’t have access to it. This year, the Tampa Police Department is proud to announce the launch of our own "Heart and Sole" Shoe Drive, beginning on Friday, March 15, 2024. This initiative aims to collect new or gently-used sneakers and shoes for children in need throughout our community. Having a good pair of shoes is essential for a child's well-being. It allows them to participate in activities, play safely, and feel confident. The brainchild of Sergeant Roni Hill, this project is another example of Tampa Police officers working to make a positive impact on the community they serve. "This shoe drive is a great example of officers going above and beyond to support our community's youth," said Chief Lee Bercaw. "Sergeant Hill's proactive approach will ensure that children in need have the footwear they deserve. By ensuring children have proper footwear, we're helping them stay healthy and active. It is these kinds of initiatives that strengthen our bonds with the community we protect and serve." Community members can also "lace up” and help stock this shoe closet by dropping off new or gently-used sneakers and shoes at any Tampa Police District Office or Headquarters. Together, we can ensure that every child in Tampa can walk with confidence.

author: Juan Carlos Díaz Guerrero
title: Venezuela: Partido Socialista Unido vaticina gran victoria electoral (+Foto)
text:
“Una gran victoria de la paz, la esperanza, la estabilidad económica, social y política de nuestro país”, manifestó el dirigente partidista durante una campaña política en el municipio Libertador, estado de Monagas (noreste), ante miles de seguidores del candidato de la Patria.
Subrayó que tenemos números extraordinarios que nos permiten llegar a esos sufragios y “esperar una gran victoria del pueblo bolivariano”.
El jefe de la Comisión de Política Interior de la Asamblea Nacional (parlamento) llamó a sentirse orgullosos de “ser revolucionarios, bolivarianos y de amar esta patria».
Cabello afirmó que las fuerzas revolucionarias y chavistas «se encuentran listas para esta batalla” electoral y llamó a tener una victoria perfecta mayoritaria que garantice la paz.
Sobre los planes de la ultraderecha para desestabilizar el país, el político bolivariano indicó que no creen en elecciones y esperan la noche del 28 de julio para salir a cantar fraude, “una película que la hemos visto muchas veces cada vez que pierden”.
En otra masiva concentración en la ciudad de Barcelona, estado de Anzoátegui (norte), Cabello expresó que ese es un territorio chavista y allí el fascismo no pasará.
Mientras la derecha incita a la salida violenta del presidente Nicolás Maduro, “el pueblo se restea (se juega todo por el todo) y sigue luchando en contra de las sanciones”, señaló.
«Contra quien sea nos debatimos en la calle, con argumentos y buen discurso» porque si algo sabemos nosotros es estar en la calle, enfatizó.
La víspera el jefe de Estado siguió de recorrido de campaña y reveló en el poblado de La Victoria, estado de Aragua (centro norte), haber visitado ya más de 100 ciudades y pueblos de todo el país, que denominó “peregrinación sagrada”.
Voy de pueblo en pueblo a despertar a la gente, subrayó, y “no puede imponerse el odio, ni la guarimba, ni el fascismo, Venezuela va a tener paz, antes, durante y después del 28 de julio”.
Los que vienen para Venezuela son tiempos de amor, paz y prosperidad y el 28 de julio se define “la violencia o la paz, la colonia o la patria independiente, la persecución y el fascismo o la libertad democrática”, remarcó.
También ayer el candidato opositor por el Partido Soluciones por Venezuela, Claudio Fermín, declaró en el canal del Estado Venezolana de Televisión que consideraba que las elecciones “están bien organizadas y serán transparentes”, y condenó toda acción generadora de violencia y conspiración.
Más de 21,6 millones de venezolanos están convocados a las urnas el 28 de julio para elegir el próximo presidente, entre los 10 candidatos en disputa, nueve opositores y un oficialista.
rgh/jcd
